website_summaries.verdict: This compact 200-BTU model is a reliable option for small pools that will likely last for years.
pros: While installation is challenging, this quick-heating model is worth the trouble
Rapidly increases the temperature of small pools over the course of a few hours
cons: Interior components are prone to rusting after several years

customer_reviews.title: Excellent winter housing for rats! :-)
customer_reviews.text: ...strongly suggest a tight fitting cover and rat/mouse traps or poisonous bait for winter rats. This is my third one as the first two's circuit boards were eaten up.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Maramara

customer_reviews.title: Worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this through Amazon rather than having my pool guy provide and install it and saved a lot of money. The delivery also worked out very well and they had the flexibility to arrange a time that was more convenient for me. As for the product itself, in my 15,000 gallon pool it will heat up the water about 2 degrees an hour. It came in handy in late May/early June, but hasn't been needed a whole lot during July and August in the warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M

customer_reviews.title: Good Heater... Easy install ..
customer_reviews.text: So just got this thing running .. working well so far .. installation went smooth. Biggest hiccups I had was 1> ordered LP version .. got NG version + LP KIt I had to install 2> uses quite a bit of Propane .. we'll probably get NG setup next year because of flow rates.
customer_reviews.author: sandinak

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my old
customer_reviews.text: Very efficient heater. Much better than my old. Raised my water temp more than one degree per hour and is very quiet, relative to my old heater, and is actually smaller. I know I'm going to use less LP per season.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Wertman

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the 200K BTU (Propaine). It heats my spa up to 104 in about an hour and a half from 72 F to 104. It is one of the more efficient propane heaters out there. Ive been using it since February 2019 without any issues. I like its low profile.
customer_reviews.author: reallybigrhino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pool Heater
customer_reviews.text: It was great once we figured out there was a switch that had to be switched from 220 volt to 110. This was just like the heater we've had for years so we replaced it with the same one.
customer_reviews.author: D. Stidham

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the investment
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 400K BTU units and they arrived on time, well packaged and with all the paperwork needed for a proper installation. My pool service people did the install and my gas company did the hook up. They appear to be bulletproof and the heated their respective pools 5 degrees in an hour. Very impressive!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Canzano

customer_reviews.title: perfect condition keeps my pool temp uniform
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was here in 2 days! perfect condition keeps my pool temp uniform, my last pool heater rusted out this one will hold up to the rain and winter with out a doubt
customer_reviews.author: Richard Davis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great is fit my old plumbing, very easy to install thanks George.
customer_reviews.author: George Pepin

customer_reviews.title: Working fine and the price was right
customer_reviews.text: Working fine and the price was right. Be sure to get it professionally installed in order to have the warranty validated.
customer_reviews.author: TexasPerson

customer_reviews.title: Heats like crazy. Also burns propane like crazy.
customer_reviews.text: Prob overkill for my pool as i only have 2 jets but i bought it to be able to use with a new house and new pool in the near future. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Ray S.

customer_reviews.title: perfectly and easily. Hopefully it will last as long as the ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the old one, perfectly and easily. Hopefully it will last as long as the orginal, 20 yrs and besides saved alot from buying from a retailer.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely great
customer_reviews.text: The savings in time and propane gas are amazing. I bought this product for my weekend home so I have to start my pool from a very low temperature, it took me more than 12 hours to raise the temperature to my requirements now It takes less than Four hours. I Am very happy with this product not only because of the savings but because of its efficiency . Jose A. Robles Mexico City
customer_reviews.author: JOSE ANTONIO ROBLES

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We love this product. Arrived on time and we are enjoying our spa.
customer_reviews.author: Ms.V

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfect right out of the box. Easy to install too. Great heater!
customer_reviews.author: Karl Singer

customer_reviews.title: What good is that
customer_reviews.text: Huge delivery mess. Carrier did not want to honor day promised. Amazon got them to agree. Multiple phone calls. Came damaged, one missing part. After crew installed, 1300.00 cost, they found crack in case and part missing. Heater worked without it and we were facing a tenant deadline of next day. Amazon offered a new heater...but no money for install!! What good is that? They offered a 30% discount or nothing. What choice do you have? Amount saved by buying from Amazon evaporated when you pay installers and Amazon does not act like a local supplier would. Will never do this again. Fine for small items, not for big projects.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Graham

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare
customer_reviews.text: This heater was new in March of 2016. We've had 4-5 service calls where it quit working. The last service call we were told it is getting "too wet" during rain storms and we need to install gutters if we want it to work. (isn't it supposed to be outside). We did install gutters. It's still not working and I'm having a hard time getting my pool company, Nassau Pools in Naples, FL, to finally decide it needs to be replaced. Not sure if it's my individual unit, or it's a bad product. I wish the manufacturer would reach out!
customer_reviews.author: Bev

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Electrician said the control board is bad. Power going in but nothing out. Maybe it was a return? it is still a lot of money for something that does not work. Outcome uncertain.
customer_reviews.author: Robert L.

customer_reviews.title: Not a millivolt unit you must have dedicated power with a fireman's switch to this heater.
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while before reviewing since it took that long to get the electrician in, water guy, and then Propane company. Not a millivolt unit you must have dedicated power with a fireman's switch to this heater. The good news is it is 110V. Once you get all that going it is a breeze to operate and pleasure to use. I have a 32 x 16 ft pool in the Northeast that it raises to 85 during a few hours while it is 75 outside. Very efficient has not changed my electric bill and only cost a few hundred dollars of propane so far.
customer_reviews.author: David W

customer_reviews.title: Constantly breaks
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had two of these, I thought the first was a bad luck lemon, well the both were, constantly breaking and needing service. I’m desperately searching for a better option.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Jones

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Sta-Rite 333 BTU model three years ago. In that time the main circuit board has had to be replaced twice (fortunately under warranty) and now the blower has failed. This is a good looking product that, when working, operates quietly and efficiently. But it has been a nightmare in terms of reliability. Three major parts failures in as many years.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Knowles

product_meta.title: Sta-Rite SR333LP Max-E-Therm Black Propane Gas Pool and Spa Heater, 333-BTU
product_meta.description:
Size:333 BTUFROM THE MANUFACTURER
For indoor or outdoor installations on pools and spas. Features include an LED temperature readout with dual thermostat controls, temperature safety lockout, and 6-position control panel. PMG burner technology requires no outdoor draft hood. Proven Dura-Glas rust-proof construction with plastic manifold and PVC union connections. Heavy-duty unit with cupro-nickel exchanger stands up to the harshest of applications, like low pH, high flow or heavy use.
feature_bullets: Lightweight - Lightest heater in its class
Compact Design - Ideal for retro-fit installation
Lower operating costs - 84% efficiency rating - rated 1st in its class for highest energy efficiency
Custom or Retrofit - Direct-connects to Sta-Rite System:3 Mod Media filter or easily fits other systems
Rustproof Housing Sleek, matte black enclosure is made of Dura-Glass - an exclusive Sta-Rite material that handles the heat and weathers the elements

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars30 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
